tests.query:
--
-- PARTITION_JOIN
-- Test partitionwise join between partitioned tables
--

-- Enable partitionwise join, which by default is disabled.
SET enable_partitionwise_join to true
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
--
-- partitioned by a single column
--
CREATE TABLE prt1 (a int, b int, c varchar) PARTITION BY RANGE(a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_p1 PARTITION OF prt1 FOR VALUES FROM (0) TO (250)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_p3 PARTITION OF prt1 FOR VALUES FROM (500) TO (600)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_p2 PARTITION OF prt1 FOR VALUES FROM (250) TO (500)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt1 SELECT i, i % 25, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 599) i WHERE i % 2 = 0
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt1_p1_a on prt1_p1(a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt1_p2_a on prt1_p2(a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt1_p3_a on prt1_p3(a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt1
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2 (a int, b int, c varchar) PARTITION BY RANGE(b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_p1 PARTITION OF prt2 FOR VALUES FROM (0) TO (250)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_p2 PARTITION OF prt2 FOR VALUES FROM (250) TO (500)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_p3 PARTITION OF prt2 FOR VALUES FROM (500) TO (600)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2 SELECT i % 25, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 599) i WHERE i % 3 = 0
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt2_p1_b on prt2_p1(b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt2_p2_b on prt2_p2(b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX iprt2_p3_b on prt2_p3(b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt2
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- inner join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- left outer join, 3-way
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM prt1 t1
  LEFT JOIN prt1 t2 ON t1.a = t2.a
  LEFT JOIN prt1 t3 ON t2.a = t3.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM prt1 t1
  LEFT JOIN prt1 t2 ON t1.a = t2.a
  LEFT JOIN prt1 t3 ON t2.a = t3.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: -- left outer join, with whole-row reference
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
partitionwise join does not apply
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1, t2 FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN prt2 t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1, t2 FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN prt2 t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- right outer join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1 RIGHT JOIN prt2 t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t2.a = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1 RIGHT JOIN prt2 t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t2.a = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- full outer join, with placeholder vars
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT 50 phv, * FROM prt1 WHERE prt1.b = 0) t1 FULL JOIN (SELECT 75 phv, * FROM prt2 WHERE prt2.a = 0) t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.phv = t1.a OR t2.phv = t2.b ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT 50 phv, * FROM prt1 WHERE prt1.b = 0) t1 FULL JOIN (SELECT 75 phv, * FROM prt2 WHERE prt2.a = 0) t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.phv = t1.a OR t2.phv = t2.b ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- Join with pruned partitions from joining relations
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b AND t1.a < 450 AND t2.b > 250 AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b AND t1.a < 450 AND t2.b > 250 AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- Currently we can't do partitioned join if nullable-side partitions are pruned
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT * FROM prt1 WHERE a < 450) t1 LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM prt2 WHERE b > 250) t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b;
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT * FROM prt1 WHERE a < 450) t1 LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM prt2 WHERE b > 250) t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b;

-- Currently we can't do partitioned join if nullable-side partitions are pruned
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT * FROM prt1 WHERE a < 450) t1 FULL JOIN (SELECT * FROM prt2 WHERE b > 250) t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 OR t2.a = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT * FROM prt1 WHERE a < 450) t1 FULL JOIN (SELECT * FROM prt2 WHERE b > 250) t2 ON t1.a = t2.b WHERE t1.b = 0 OR t2.a = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- Semi-join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.* FROM prt1 t1 WHERE t1.a IN (SELECT t2.b FROM prt2 t2 WHERE t2.a = 0) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.* FROM prt1 t1 WHERE t1.a IN (SELECT t2.b FROM prt2 t2 WHERE t2.a = 0) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- Anti-join with aggregates
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT sum(t1.a), avg(t1.a), sum(t1.b), avg(t1.b) FROM prt1 t1 WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT sum(t1.a), avg(t1.a), sum(t1.b), avg(t1.b) FROM prt1 t1 WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2 t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- lateral reference
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT * FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT t2.a AS t2a, t3.a AS t3a, least(t1.a,t2.a,t3.b) FROM prt1 t2 JOIN prt2 t3 ON (t2.a = t3.b)) ss
			  ON t1.a = ss.t2a WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
SELECT * FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT t2.a AS t2a, t3.a AS t3a, least(t1.a,t2.a,t3.b) FROM prt1 t2 JOIN prt2 t3 ON (t2.a = t3.b)) ss
			  ON t1.a = ss.t2a WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, ss.t2a, ss.t2c FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT t2.a AS t2a, t3.a AS t3a, t2.b t2b, t2.c t2c, least(t1.a,t2.a,t3.b) FROM prt1 t2 JOIN prt2 t3 ON (t2.a = t3.b)) ss
			  ON t1.c = ss.t2c WHERE (t1.b + coalesce(ss.t2b, 0)) = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
SELECT t1.a, ss.t2a, ss.t2c FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT t2.a AS t2a, t3.a AS t3a, t2.b t2b, t2.c t2c, least(t1.a,t2.a,t3.a) FROM prt1 t2 JOIN prt2 t3 ON (t2.a = t3.b)) ss
			  ON t1.c = ss.t2c WHERE (t1.b + coalesce(ss.t2b, 0)) = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- lateral reference in sample scan
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT * FROM prt1 t1 JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT * FROM prt1 t2 TABLESAMPLE SYSTEM (t1.a) REPEATABLE(t1.b)) s
			  ON t1.a = s.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql
partition_join.sql

tests.query:
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM prt1_l t1 LEFT JOIN LATERAL
			  (SELECT t1.b AS t1b, t2.* FROM prt2_l t2) s
			  ON t1.a = s.b AND t1.b = s.a AND t1.c = s.c
			  WHERE s.t1b = s.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- join with one side empty
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM (SELECT * FROM prt1_l WHERE a = 1 AND a = 2) t1 RIGHT JOIN prt2_l t2 ON t1.a = t2.b AND t1.b = t2.a AND t1.c = t2.c
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- Test case to verify proper handling of subqueries in a partitioned delete.
-- The weird-looking lateral join is just there to force creation of a
-- nestloop parameter within the subquery, which exposes the problem if the
-- planner fails to make multiple copies of the subquery as appropriate.
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
DELETE FROM prt1_l
WHERE EXISTS (
  SELECT 1
    FROM int4_tbl,
         LATERAL (SELECT int4_tbl.f1 FROM int8_tbl LIMIT 2) ss
    WHERE prt1_l.c IS NULL)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
--
-- negative testcases
--
CREATE TABLE prt1_n (a int, b int, c varchar) PARTITION BY RANGE(c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_n_p1 PARTITION OF prt1_n FOR VALUES FROM ('0000') TO ('0250')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_n_p2 PARTITION OF prt1_n FOR VALUES FROM ('0250') TO ('0500')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt1_n SELECT i, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 499, 2) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt1_n
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_n (a int, b int, c text) PARTITION BY LIST(c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_n_p1 PARTITION OF prt2_n FOR VALUES IN ('0000', '0003', '0004', '0010', '0006', '0007')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_n_p2 PARTITION OF prt2_n FOR VALUES IN ('0001', '0005', '0002', '0009', '0008', '0011')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2_n SELECT i, i, to_char(i/50, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 599, 2) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt2_n
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt3_n (a int, b int, c text) PARTITION BY LIST(c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt3_n_p1 PARTITION OF prt3_n FOR VALUES IN ('0000', '0004', '0006', '0007')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt3_n_p2 PARTITION OF prt3_n FOR VALUES IN ('0001', '0002', '0008', '0010')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt3_n_p3 PARTITION OF prt3_n FOR VALUES IN ('0003', '0005', '0009', '0011')
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2_n SELECT i, i, to_char(i/50, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 599, 2) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt3_n
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt4_n (a int, b int, c text) PARTITION BY RANGE(a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt4_n_p1 PARTITION OF prt4_n FOR VALUES FROM (0) TO (300)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt4_n_p2 PARTITION OF prt4_n FOR VALUES FROM (300) TO (500)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt4_n_p3 PARTITION OF prt4_n FOR VALUES FROM (500) TO (600)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt4_n SELECT i, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(0, 599, 2) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt4_n
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- partitionwise join can not be applied if the partition ranges differ
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt4_n t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1, prt4_n t2, prt2 t3 WHERE t1.a = t2.a and t1.a = t3.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- partitionwise join can not be applied if there are no equi-join conditions
-- between partition keys
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1 t1 LEFT JOIN prt2 t2 ON (t1.a < t2.b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- equi-join with join condition on partial keys does not qualify for
-- partitionwise join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_m t1, prt2_m t2 WHERE t1.a = (t2.b + t2.a)/2
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- equi-join between out-of-order partition key columns does not qualify for
-- partitionwise join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_m t1 LEFT JOIN prt2_m t2 ON t1.a = t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- equi-join between non-key columns does not qualify for partitionwise join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_m t1 LEFT JOIN prt2_m t2 ON t1.c = t2.c
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- partitionwise join can not be applied for a join between list and range
-- partitioned tables
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_n t1 LEFT JOIN prt2_n t2 ON (t1.c = t2.c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- partitionwise join can not be applied between tables with different
-- partition lists
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_n t1 JOIN prt2_n t2 ON (t1.c = t2.c) JOIN plt1 t3 ON (t1.c = t3.c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- partitionwise join can not be applied for a join between key column and
-- non-key column
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_n t1 FULL JOIN prt1 t2 ON (t1.c = t2.c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
--
-- Test some other plan types in a partitionwise join (unfortunately,
-- we need larger tables to get the planner to choose these plan types)
--
create temp table prtx1 (a integer, b integer, c integer)
  partition by range (a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx1_1 partition of prtx1 for values from (1) to (11)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx1_2 partition of prtx1 for values from (11) to (21)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx1_3 partition of prtx1 for values from (21) to (31)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
create temp table prtx2 (a integer, b integer, c integer)
  partition by range (a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx2_1 partition of prtx2 for values from (1) to (11)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx2_2 partition of prtx2 for values from (11) to (21)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create temp table prtx2_3 partition of prtx2 for values from (21) to (31)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
insert into prtx1 select 1 + i%30, i, i
  from generate_series(1,1000) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
insert into prtx2 select 1 + i%30, i, i
  from generate_series(1,500) i, generate_series(1,10) j
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create index on prtx2 (b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: create index on prtx2 (c)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: analyze prtx1
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: analyze prtx2
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
explain (costs off)
select * from prtx1
where not exists (select 1 from prtx2
                  where prtx2.a=prtx1.a and prtx2.b=prtx1.b and prtx2.c=123)
  and a<20 and c=120
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
select * from prtx1
where not exists (select 1 from prtx2
                  where prtx2.a=prtx1.a and prtx2.b=prtx1.b and prtx2.c=123)
  and a<20 and c=120
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
explain (costs off)
select * from prtx1
where not exists (select 1 from prtx2
                  where prtx2.a=prtx1.a and (prtx2.b=prtx1.b+1 or prtx2.c=99))
  and a<20 and c=91
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
select * from prtx1
where not exists (select 1 from prtx2
                  where prtx2.a=prtx1.a and (prtx2.b=prtx1.b+1 or prtx2.c=99))
  and a<20 and c=91
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
--
-- Test advanced partition-matching algorithm for partitioned join
--

-- Tests for range-partitioned tables
CREATE TABLE prt1_adv (a int, b int, c varchar) PARTITION BY RANGE (a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_adv_p1 PARTITION OF prt1_adv FOR VALUES FROM (100) TO (200)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_adv_p2 PARTITION OF prt1_adv FOR VALUES FROM (200) TO (300)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt1_adv_p3 PARTITION OF prt1_adv FOR VALUES FROM (300) TO (400)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX prt1_adv_a_idx ON prt1_adv (a)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt1_adv SELECT i, i % 25, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(100, 399) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt1_adv
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_adv (a int, b int, c varchar) PARTITION BY RANGE (b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_adv_p1 PARTITION OF prt2_adv FOR VALUES FROM (100) TO (150)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_adv_p2 PARTITION OF prt2_adv FOR VALUES FROM (200) TO (300)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE TABLE prt2_adv_p3 PARTITION OF prt2_adv FOR VALUES FROM (350) TO (500)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: CREATE INDEX prt2_adv_b_idx ON prt2_adv (b)
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2_adv_p1 SELECT i % 25, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(100, 149) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2_adv_p2 SELECT i % 25, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(200, 299) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: INSERT INTO prt2_adv_p3 SELECT i % 25, i, to_char(i, 'FM0000') FROM generate_series(350, 499) i
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: ANALYZE prt2_adv
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- inner join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_adv t1 INNER JOIN prt2_adv t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_adv t1 INNER JOIN prt2_adv t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- semi join

SELECT t1.* FROM prt1_adv t1 WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2_adv t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.* FROM prt1_adv t1 WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2_adv t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- left join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_adv t1 LEFT JOIN prt2_adv t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.a, t1.c, t2.b, t2.c FROM prt1_adv t1 LEFT JOIN prt2_adv t2 ON (t1.a = t2.b) WHERE t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a, t2.b
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
-- anti join
EXPLAIN (COSTS OFF)
SELECT t1.* FROM prt1_adv t1 WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2_adv t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query: SELECT t1.* FROM prt1_adv t1 WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM prt2_adv t2 WHERE t1.a = t2.b) AND t1.b = 0 ORDER BY t1.a
tests.name: partition_join.sql

tests.query:
